intro: Tephroseris reverdattoi, commonly known as the red sandras, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Tephroseris reverdattoi is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine.
